isis.stitle: CAB: 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 AND 8600 MODELS - REMOVE - ELECTRIC WINDSHIELD WIPER MOTOR

svcsubproc.title: Remove Electric Windshield Wiper Motor on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models
svcsubproc.para: The windshield wiper system consists of a single unitized 12 volt electric motor that operates the wiper arms through linkage (Figure 122) .
Since the wiper motor is of unitized construction, there is no need for motor rebuild or adjustments. There are no serviceable parts; the complete assembly is replaced.

caution.para: Do not attempt to move the blades through their sweep by grasping the wiper arm. This action may result in the teeth being broken off the drive gear or the linkage bent. If blades are frozen to windshield, do not operate control switch until they have been freed.

step1.para: With ignition key in ON position, cycle wiper arm to the end of the sweep cycle (wiper blade by left side of windshield). Turn key to OFF position.
Unlatch hood on both sides and tilt hood to fully open position.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 121 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Disconnect wiring harness connector (Item 1) from windshield wiper motor connector (Item 2).

If required, cut ty-wrap (Item 12, view arrow A) securing wiring harness (Item 13, view arrow A) to windshield wiper motor (Item 6) and/or windshield wiper motor mounting bracket (Item 4, view arrow A).

note.para: Windshield wipers and cowl tray have been removed in part of Figure 122 to show the windshield wiper assembly located under the cowl tray.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 122 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove hex retaining nut (Item 1, view arrow A and view arrow B) securing wiper drive arm (Item 2, view arrow A) to electric wiper motor (Item 3, view arrow A). Remove wiper drive arm and lock washer (Items 2 and 4, view arrow A) from electric wiper motor shaft. Lay wiper drive arm and wiper linkage (Items 2 and 5, view arrow A) on the wiper motor mounting bracket (Item 6, view arrow A). Lay hex retaining nut and lock washer aside and save for installation.

With the wiper drive arm (Item 2, view arrow A) and wiper linkage (Item 5, view arrow A) out of the way. Remove three hex flanged bolts (Item 7, view arrow A) securing electric wiper motor (Item 3, view arrow A) to the wiper motor mounting bracket (Item 6, view arrow A) and remove electric wiper motor. Save hex flanged bolts and electric wiper motor for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.
